newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Scania says European truck market bottomed out.
newsitem.headline: Scania says European truck market bottomed out.

text.p: Swedish truck maker Scania said on Thursday that the European truck market has bottomed out, but there was still pressure on prices.

"The annual rate has been about 150,000 trucks in the past two quarters," Scania chief executive Leif Ostling told a news conference. "The market will not fall beneath that, we have reached a kind of bottom."
But he said the market in Europe would remained uncertain.
"There is still a lot of uncertainty surrounding the market in Europe," he said. "There is significant price pressure now as volumes are decreasing."
On Britain, Ostling said it was possible the company had bought slightly too much transport capacity in 1995 and 1996.
